page.title: 18SMUGGLING IN BEDGEBURY AREA
page.content: Bedgebury area has smuggling legends although the more factual accounts concern Goudhurst and Hawkhurst between which Bedgebury Forest lies, e.g. that of the Hawkhurst Gang who terrorised the locality till defeated in a battle at Goudhurst in 1747. The house named Spyways in Goudhurst High Street, overlooking the Forest, and Smugley Farm, between Goudhurst and Bedgebury, are both connected with smuggling, the latter being where the last local smugglers were arrested. Tubslake, on the east side of the Forest, has a pond reputed to be where tubs or kegs of contraband liquor were hidden until collected for forwarding. Richard Church, the Kentish author, considered the independent outlook and good manners of the local people to be attributable to the anti-bureaucratic attitude fostered by smuggling!
